snippet: The final report on the crash that killed 228 people concluded that errors in the cockpit were the outcome of a confluence of factors beyond the competence of any individual pilot.
abstract: French investigators’ final report on the 2009 crash of an Air France jet that killed 228 people concludes that the errors were the outcome of a confluence of factors beyond the competence of any individual pilot; portrays a cockpit rapidly consumed by confusion and unable to decode a welter of alarms to determine which flight readings could be trusted.
lead_paragraph: The final report on the crash that killed 228 people concluded that errors in the cockpit were the outcome of a confluence of factors beyond the competence of any individual pilot.

headline.seo: Report on Air France Flight 447 Cites Conflicting Data in Cockpit
headline.main: Report on ’09 Air France Crash Cites Conflicting Data in Cockpit
headline.print_headline: Report Cites Cockpit Confusion in Air France Crash
